text: Callinectes (Blue crabs) is a genus of crabs. Sixteen species are in this genus. These species include the Atlantic blue crab, C. sapidus: *Callinectes affinis Fausto, 1980 *Callinectes amnicola (Rochebrune, 1883) *Callinectes arcuatus Ordway, 1863 *Callinectes bellicosus Stimpson, 1859 *Callinectes bocourti A. Milne-Edwards, 1879 *Callinectes danae Smith, 1869 *Callinectes diacanthus *Callinectes exasperatus (Gerstaecker, 1856) *Callinectes gladiator Benedict, 1893 *Callinectes marginatus (A. Milne-Edwards, 1861) *Callinectes ornatus Ordway, 1863 *Callinectes pallidus (Rochebrune, 1883) *Callinectes rathbunae Contreras, 1930 *Callinectes sapidus Rathbun, 1896 *Callinectes similis Williams, 1966 *Callinectes toxotes Ordway, 1863 ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Portunidae
title: Callinectes
